doc.after: Confessions on a Dance Floor peaked at number one in 40 countries, earning a place in the 2007 Guinness Book of World Records as the album topping the charts in most countries. In the United States, the album debuted at number one on the Billboard 200 chart, selling 350,000 copies in its first week. It became her sixth number one album on the chart and the third consecutive album to debut at the top, following Music (2000) and American Life (2003).[36] To date, the album has sold over 1.703 million copies in America, according to Nielsen SoundScan.[37] On December 14, 2005, the album was certified platinum by the Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA) for shipments of one million copies of the album.[38] In Australia, the album debuted at the top of the chart for the issue dated November 21, 2005.[39] It has since been certified two times platinum by the Australian Recording Industry Association (ARIA) denoting shipments of 140,000 copies.[40] The album also debuted at the top of the charts in Canada, with first-week sales of 74,000.[41]
